closed_or_rejected_prs.status: closed by maintainer due to framework bug (multiple PRs in one run merged incorrectly)

framework_note: CRITICAL: Only create ONE PR per run. The framework has a bug where if create_pull_request is called multiple times, only one PR is created with wrong mixed content.
next_run_todo: Prepare release 3.3.2 - target ~2026-02-24 - includes mapAsyncUnorderedParallelThrottled, chunkBy/chunkByAsync, mergeAll seq, deps/license, Blazor WASM fix

Continue v4 BCL IAsyncEnumerable migration (PR branch: repo-assist/v4-bcl-iasyncenumerable-migration) - waiting for dsyme answers on: (1) Fable support, (2) ofAsyncEnum/toAsyncEnum obsolete/remove, (3) IAsyncSeqEnumerator/AsyncSeqImpl EditorBrowsable
Once dsyme reviews v4 PR: address feedback, possibly update README/RELEASE_NOTES, remove ofAsyncEnum/toAsyncEnum stubs

v4_migration_notes.status: draft PR created; all 190 tests pass
v4_migration_notes.approach: AsyncSeq<'T> = BCL IAsyncEnumerable<'T>; internal IAsyncSeqEnumerator<'T> and AsyncSeqImpl<'T> adapter; GetEnumerator() extension on BCL type for internal use (not exported via .fsi); ofAsyncEnum/toAsyncEnum are now identity functions
breaking_changes: Custom enumerator implementations need rewriting to BCL IAsyncEnumerator pattern

notes: Issue #230 opened by dsyme on 2026-02-22 - 'Use System.IAsyncDisposable through this library' - run 17 commented; run 18 created draft v4 PR
dsyme responded to #230 (2026-02-22T09:34): 'We should switch to the standard dotnet IAsyncEnumerable and take the breaking change with a major version bump'
v4 migration: AsyncSeq<'T> = System.Collections.Generic.IAsyncEnumerable<'T>; internal machinery preserved via IAsyncSeqEnumerator<'T> adapter; all 190 tests pass
